data.name: MeasureProperties
desc: This service describes a MeasureShape.
**since**

properties.name: MeasureBelowReferenceEdge
desc: If this property is TRUE, the measure is drawn below the reference edge instead of above it.

properties.name: MeasureDecimalPlaces
desc: This value is the number of decimal places that is used to format the measure value.
**since**

properties.name: MeasureHelpLine1Length
desc: This is the length of the first help line.

properties.name: MeasureHelpLine2Length
desc: This is the length of the second help line.

properties.name: MeasureHelpLineDistance
desc: This is the distance from the measure line to the start of the help lines.

properties.name: MeasureHelpLineOverhang
desc: This is the overhang of the two help lines.

properties.name: MeasureKind
desc: This enumeration specifies the MeasureKind.

properties.name: MeasureLineDistance
desc: This is the distance from the reference edge to the measure line.

properties.name: MeasureOverhang
desc: This is the overhang of the reference line over the help lines.

properties.name: MeasureShowUnit
desc: If this is TRUE, the unit of measure is shown in the measure text.

properties.name: MeasureTextAutoAngle
desc: If this is TRUE, the angle of the measure is set automatically.

properties.name: MeasureTextAutoAngleView
desc: This is the automatic angle.

properties.name: MeasureTextFixedAngle
desc: This is the fixed angle.

properties.name: MeasureTextHorizontalPosition
desc: This is the horizontal position of the measure text.

properties.name: MeasureTextIsFixedAngle
desc: If this value is TRUE, the measure has a fixed angle.

properties.name: MeasureTextRotate90
desc: If this value is TRUE, the text is rotated 90 degrees.

properties.name: MeasureTextUpsideDown
desc: If this value is TRUE, the text is printed upside down.

properties.name: MeasureTextVerticalPosition
desc: This is the vertical position of the text.
